intro: Secamone sinica, commonly known as Chinese secamone, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds when mature. Secamone sinica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests.
